statement: Adults with suspected pancreatic cancer have their diagnosis and care agreed by a specialist pancreatic cancer multidisciplinary team (MDT).
Adults with localised pancreatic cancer on CT have staging using fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography/CT (FDGâ€‘PET/CT) before they have surgery, radiotherapy or systemic therapy.
Adults with resectable pancreatic cancer and obstructive jaundice have resectional surgery rather than preoperative biliary drainage unless the drainage is specifically indicated.
Adults with unresectable pancreatic cancer are prescribed enteric-coated pancreatin.
[Placeholder: Effective interventions to address psychological needs]
